thread.title: Texas Motor Speedway adding more SAFER barriers at track
thread.title_full: Texas Motor Speedway adding more SAFER barriers at track

author: Get Ready for an Earthquake, NASA Tells L.A.
title: Texas Motor Speedway adding more SAFER barriers at track
text:
Texas Motor Speedway adding more SAFER barriers at track Associated Press 17 hrs ago Â© (AP Photo/Larry Papke Jimmie Johnson (48) heads to the pits during the NASCAR Sprint Cup auto race at Texas Motor Speedway in Fort Worth, Texas, Saturday, April 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Larry Papke) FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) -- The entire inside wall of the backstretch at Texas Motor Speedway and the interior walls at the entry and exit of pit road will have energy-absorbing barriers in place when NASCAR races there in two weekends.
AdChoices There were already SAFER barriers on high-impact exterior walls at the 1 1/2-mile track, but speedway officials said Wednesday that the installation of an additional 2,866 feet to select areas should be completed this week.
Along with the inside walls, SAFER barriers are being added to three exterior sections on the frontstretch, directly across from the entry and exit of the pits, and at the start-finish line.
Another 2,103 feet of safety barrier will be installed before NASCAR returns next April, and every wall will be protected following a third phase after that.
